intro: Ranunculus cherubicus subsp. cherubicus, commonly known as the angel's tears, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with prominent red sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and thrives in well-drained, moist soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is generally rare in the wild.
